column4: I have a PDF that is being printed directly to the printer as PDF, but the printer does not support it.  Is it evince that is supposed to do the conversion to PS or cups?
sure; either print or print to file in evince
Not sure you're understanding.  When printing from PDF, it sends the job as a PDF directly to the printer.
how have you determined this? what kind of printer?
Output on the printer gives an error message.  It's an HP 4250.
and the printer is directly on the network? perhaps the printer driver is misconfigured in cups
Yes, direct printing from the workstation.
I guess I'll look into resetting it up.  We took the printers.conf from an older ubuntu machine when we upgraded to 10.04.
what is the exact error you get on the printer's display?
This was the only output, on paper, from the printer:  PDF File not printed. 128 MB of memory is required to enable direct PDF printing
looks like direct pdf printing is a new feature in cups, so you'll need to disable it in the cups configuration
would that be cups' configuration or the printer's configuration?
there's a line starting with *cupsFilter:    "application/vnd.cups-pdf  in the ppd file which describes the printer to cups
but there may be a more convenient way to change it
There is no cupsFilter lines in the ppd.

I'm not an expert on cups, but I see "Filter application/vnd.cups-pdf 0 foomatic-rip" in my /etc/cups/printers.conf, but I guess you probably don't have that if you copied the configuration from an older version
